headline: Snickerdoodles I
description: This is a wonderful and easy cookie that my mother prepared for at least 50 years. Every time I take them somewhere everyone wants the recipe.

video.description: In this video, you’ll see how to make an easy snickerdoodle recipe. Roll the dough in cinnamon sugar before baking for a classic cookie that’s a favorite any time of year. Crispy at the edges and so tender in the middle, these 5-star cookies make ter
video.name: Snickerdoodles I

name: Snickerdoodles I

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

In a medium bowl, cream together the shortening and 1 1/2 cups sugar. Stir in the eggs. Sift together the flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, and salt; stir into the creamed mixture until well blended. In a small bowl, stir together the 2 tablespoons of sugar, and the cinnamon. Roll dough into walnut sized balls, then roll the balls in the cinnamon-sugar. Place them onto an unprepared cookie sheet, two inches apart.
Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Edges should be slightly brown. Remove from sheets to cool on wire racks.

review.reviewBody: I’ve used this same recipe for 45 years. Needless to say, it makes the perfect snickerdoodle. I bake for 8 minutes and use the bread trick in my containers. They are the only snickerdoodle for my family!! My original recipe came from an old Menonite cookbook. Yummy.

I made these for our bowling league and everyone loved them! I did read some of the reviews and agree that when baking, only do it until set. Otherwise they get hard and don't retain their chewy center. Also, I haven't tried it with butter flavored shortening yet, but I plan on trying it next time after seeing all of the recommendations!
I add 1 t. Vanilla and a t. Cornstarch for extra chewiness. No one can eat just one!
Made it no changes turned out great
these are GREAT cookies. i halfed the recipe and cut back a little on the sugar. 9 min.

The 10-minute baking time is for real. They are very soft when they come out of the oven but they harden up. Also don't refrigerate the dough - make sure it is soft when you roll the balls. If they're too hard they pick up only cinnamon and no sugar.
Great flavor.
Puffed up. Came out more like scones than cookies.
tasted real good
THE BEST Snickerdoodles … per my entire family
I may have already written a review a long time ago, but I still think…PERFECT! Just like mom’s.

Turned out beautiful! Tastes delicious. The one suggestion I tried from other members- try butter- flavored shortening. Works like a charm. Yum yum. Fool-proof recipe, even my toddlers helped roll dough into balls and had fun dipping cinnamon + sugar mixture! Just like with my mom when I was a girl.
I make Snickerdoodles for my family all the time using this great recipe. Only I use all butter. Turns out perfect. To each his own.

Fantastic recipe! I followed it exactly and they turned out perfectly. As other reviewers have mentioned, just make sure not to over-bake. They may seem undercooked at 8 minutes but trust me, they will harden up into the crunchy exterior, chewy center as they cool.
it was good except i burnt it..... oops

This recipe was delicious! I used butter instead of shortening because we didn’t have any shortening, and it didn’t make a difference. I did end up keeping these in the oven for an extra few minutes since my baking pan size caused the cookies to somewhat melt together (it like squish? I don’t understand how to describe it). Overall, though, this was a great recipe, and when I make it again I’ll probably make a half recipe
All I can say is YUM!! They are my fiancé’s favorite!
Super easy. Wouldn’t change a thing. They came out perfect.
Great recipe, I added ginger to the cinnamon sugar dusting.
Yummy
These are the perfect snickerdoodle cookies hands down! Delicious! Thanks for sharing this recipe.
I give these out as presents and people always ask for more. The best!

6/12/2021
Emma A. made these today
Everyone at the party loved them. Myself I thought they were a little bit to brittle. They started to break when I packed them to move them to the party.
Loved it and no I didn't change anything

It tastes great, the cinnamon sugar powder is a great addition that finished it off to perfection. However, in the oven it puffed up super big so it looked just like a scone and not a flat cookies. I think it is because I added too much baking soda. Make sure you add a little less baking soda to get the flat thin cookie feel. Great, easy, simple recipe that is perfect to serve at gatherings.
These really are the best snickerdoodles I've ever made. I don't change a thing!

One of my best friends used to make Snickerdoodles all the time. I found her recipe and it’s identical to this one! That made me happy! I made them exactly as this recipe said only I increased the baking time to 12 minutes. I tried 7-8 minutes and they weren’t done and were way too soft. I didn’t have butter flavored shortening so I added 1 teaspoon of butter flavoring. Other than than I made no changes. They are delicious! Soft and chewy and so yummy!
This are amazing. I followed the recipe and used a small cookie scoop. This recipe yielded 48 cookies.
Wonderful!
Delicious! No changes, made as is. Easy, makes a bunch of soft, delicious, perfectly textured snickerdoodles. Thank you!
Awesome cookie as written.
I'm trying to use things from the pantry & happened to have Crisco sticks. This was best use for them, they are fantastic! Easy to make & what's more comforting than cinnamon ;)
Snickerdoodles are some of my favorite cookies so I was overjoyed to see this homemade recipe. And boy oh boy, this recipe did not disappoint! It’s definitely a keeper.
Perfect snickerdoodle recipe.

So, I made these GF. They were a big hit, but did not change from the ‘ball’ drop. I pressed them down out of the oven. Since i need to make GF sandwiches with ice cream, I will try rolling them out and use cookie cutters....stay tuned!
No. Great recipe!
I was out of shortening but they turned out great
I made a triple batch...Everyone loves them! I have a dozen to my boss and she didn't even share with her family!
My husbands favorite cookie
Delicious!!
Works every time! I switch out the shortening for butter (1:1) as a personal preference. I may also be a little generous with the cinnamon :) Yum!
These snickerdoodless turned out SO SO good! This really is perfect!
This was my first time making snickerdoodles, and it was way easier than I expected! I will definitely make these again.
Perfect snickerdoodles! Use butter flavor Crisco for the shortening.
I had to use butter in place of the shortening. I would prefer to make them half the size the recipe calls for. I'll have to play with the time some.
It was really easy and yummy my family don't usually like trying new things but they were all over it.
Made it !!! the cookies were wonderful. This is an excellent, easy, tasty recipe. almost fool proof.

I followed the recipe. The dough was a little crumbly after all the ingredients were mixed together. The cookies turned out great & they are delicious.
This is the first time that I have made these cookies.
No I didn't made no changes and yes I will make it again.
I never made these before so I read the reviews over well. They turned out GREAT! Good advice to not over bake and I also used the butter flavored Crisco.
Over cooked the first batch but the rest came out great.
Just like I remembered; soft, chewy with great cinnamon and sugar taste. Made the recipe exactly as given and was careful not to over cook.

This is my go-to Snickerdoodle recipe. It's simple, it's quick, and it's delicious. I use margarine in place of shortening, and I add 1/2 teaspoon of Cinnamon and 1/4 teaspoon of Nutmeg to the dough and a few shakes of nutmeg (and sometimes colored sugar) to the cinnamon topping, but those are my only changes. It's not only my favorite, but my daughter's, and several of her friends as well.
Used butter instead
I doubled the coconut and left out the corn flakes!
Will definitely make again.
Instead of shortening I used butter and they turned out great!
How many servings though?

These cookies are good. Mine didn't flatten at all. Hard to tell when they're done when they're coated in cinnamon and sugar - I cooked them for roughly 10 minutes and I got 52 cookies. I substituted half the sugar with a sugar substitute as I was making them for a diabetic friend.
Snickerdoodles are my husband's favorite cookie. I somehow lost my recipe. I have tried other recipes but none lived up to my original recipe.
No changes. Came out perfect...crunchy on outside and chewy on the inside.
They came out good but they never look like the pictures or those I get in bakeries.

The perfect Snickerdoodle! My family loves these cookies.
 No vanilla extract so it lets the flavor of the ingredients come through. I do use half butter, half shortening, instead of all shortening, as the option that my original recipe gave from my Betty Crocker Cooky Book!

This was my first time baking snickerdoodle cookies and these turned out excellent! I made alternations based on other reviews. Butter-flavored shortening is a must. I added 1 1/2 tsp of Dominican vanilla extract. I planned to bake it for 6 mins so it didn’t overcook, but it wasn’t enough. The center looked uncooked. I realized this AFTER taking them out, and placing them on a cooling rack ( cooling rack is also a must) and eating one. So I put it back in the oven, same temp preheated and baked it for 2 more mins. It turned out perfect in texture. Slightly crispy on the edges, chewy on the inside. So the next batch will bake for 6 mins, cool, then bake for another 2 mins — I’m too scared to try it any other way, they were that good!
Very good! Made no changes and they were perfect!
Tad bit cakey, but all the flavors are there.
This is my go to snickerdoodle recipe. Always perfect!
Great cookies, substitute the cream of tarter for 3 tsp of baking powder!
I love this recipe! So simple and easy to mix together and bake. I didn't change a thing, perfect just the way it is. Thanks for sharing this recipe.

Made twice, the cookies tasted really good but I don't know why they still went flat both times. The 2nd time I chilled the remaining batch in the fridge and they turned out a bit better but still not like the ones in pictures most people posted.
Made precisely as written. Consistency was perfect, looked perfect and my 1 4 yo liked them; however, I personally do not care for the shortening flavor. Will be looking for a real butter recipe.
I followed the recipe exactly and they turned out great
These are delicious! If you like soft cookies; I always bake cookies at 300 degrees for about 18-20 minutes. Works like a charm!
Crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside. Perfect snickerdoodles.
Wonderful! I did sub butter for the shortening. Be careful not to bake too long. I did 6 minutes and they were perfect!
Delicious recipe & homemade looking cookies. My boyfriend loved them. I wish there was a way to use less sugar, but I guess that’s the point!

made exactly how recipe said , I changed a couple things because I am baking at higher altitude (over 3,000 ft) but they turned out perfect. 8 minutes on a non stick cookie sheet is all I had to bake them for at 400 degrees F. (I added 25 degrees to baking time due to higher altitude above sea level.)
Perfect ! Followed recipe exactly, used my 2Tb scoop, baked 9.5 minutes.....made 24 good sized cookies!

These turned out better than the recipe I made two weeks ago that used butter and shortening. Those fell flat, literally. This recipe makes a soft and chewy cookie that tastes like I remember Snickerdoodles tasting like when I was a kid. I added vanilla as another reviewer did.
So yummy! No changes and they are perfect snickerdoodles!
It was perfect! I added some caramel to add in the center and topped it with sea salt for my own twist!
My husband is diabetic so I used Splenda in place of the sugar. He absolutely loved them!

I just took these cookies out of the oven minutes ago. I let it cool and it looked so pretty I couldn't resist taking one. OMG!! This little gem is delicious :) I never ate let alone made this cookie before and followed the recipe exactly. They puffed up in the oven and when they came out they flattened just a little which made them crackle a bit. I did not roll them in cinnamon and sugar because cinnamon makes my blood sugar drop but I just sprinkled a little on top before cooking. I also added vanilla in the shortening mixture. Will definitely make these again but I will not wait for the holidays that's for sure. Thanks for this great recipe.
I've made these several times this holiday season. Plan on making and keeping these in the freezer year round. Can't get enough of them.
My cookies turned out flat and like a sheet of cookies, not individual, even when I did make the balls. I burned them, but that was mostly my fault. They did taste good on ice cream though!!!!
You can use applesauce instead of egg which my family found out long ago for almost any recipe. It works almost perfectly the same. (1/4 cup applesauce : 1 egg)
its delicious i love them they are the best i know i will make them again

I added 1 tsp of vanilla extract, 1/2 tsp almond extract and 1tsp of ground cinnamon to the dough recipe to give them a bit of flavor and everyone loved them. Had a hard time having any left on the cooling racks to even put away!
I’ve used this recipe twice and both times they have turned out fantastic!
If you didn't like this recipe then you either don't like cinnamon or messed up the recipe! It's perfect. Make sure you sift the flour to ensure the lightness of the cookie.
Amazing! My husband absolutely loved these cookies. Just like he remembered as a kid.
Easy to make and so good.

Had to bake the full 10 minutes and let the cookies sit on the pan for an additional 3-4 minutes for them to be thoroughly baked, but they came out beautifully. Best looking Snickerdoodles I've made in years. :)
Did not taste authentic enough, snickerdoodles' texture should be crumbly but fluffy.
Make them all the time

I liked the recipe, but maybe not too much shortening. The dough was awesome and I made it multiple times. Also, try to use more sugar and less cinnamon for the top part. Other than that, it was the PERFECT dough Linda. Thanks!
Delicious! I will definitely be making this recipe again!

I followed the recipe to a tee.. and they are terrible. They have no flavor. I wouldn't even give these to the drunks at the bar. I was in a pinch and couldn't find my family recipe in time. Hind sight I should have gone without.
They tasted good, but for some reason mine didn't come out flat! They were little puffy mounds. Any suggestions?
